summary: The Hospital Inpatient Services Modernization Act (S. 2237) amends the Social Security Act to extend the availability of acute hospital care at home waiver flexibilities, originally set to expire in 2025, to 2030. It also mandates the Secretary of Health and Human Services to conduct a study analyzing the criteria for the Acute Hospital Care at Home initiative, comparing quality of care, costs, and other metrics between in-hospital and at-home care, and considering factors like selection bias. A report on this study is due to Congress by September 30, 2028.
